definition: a habitual and usually trivial defect or shortcoming : foible
examples: suffered from the vice of curiosity

definition: a physical imperfection, deformity, or taint
a character representing one of the vices in an English morality play
an abnormal behavior pattern in a domestic animal detrimental to its health or usefulness
in the place of, rather than
examples: I will preside, vice the absent chairman

definition: one that takes the place of
